name: Chocolate Horchata
description: This Mexican chocolate horchata is the perfect drink to cooldown this summer. The traditional combination of soaked rice and milk is givenan upgrade with this artisanal Mexican chocolate tablillas from Hernan.
recipeIngredient: 1 1/2 cups Soy, (unsweetened (or your favorite plant milk))

recipeInstructions.text: In a heat resistant container, combine the rice, Mexican chocolate tablillas, and cinnamon.
recipeInstructions.name: In a heat resistant container, combine the rice, Mexican chocolate tablillas, and cinnamon.

recipeInstructions.text: In a medium pot, bring the 3 cups of water to a boil. Pour over the rice and refrigerate overnight.
recipeInstructions.name: In a medium pot, bring the 3 cups of water to a boil. Pour over the rice and refrigerate overnight.

recipeInstructions.text: The following day blend the mixture until smooth and strain through a fine mesh strainer.
recipeInstructions.name: The following day blend the mixture until smooth and strain through a fine mesh strainer.

recipeInstructions.text: Add the vanilla, sugar, and soy milk and blend again until smooth.
recipeInstructions.name: Add the vanilla, sugar, and soy milk and blend again until smooth.

recipeInstructions.text: Strain through a cheesecloth or nut bag.
recipeInstructions.name: Strain through a cheesecloth or nut bag.

recipeInstructions.text: Serve over ice and sprinkle with ground cinnamon. Enjoy!
